title: Part A

descriptions:

· The molecular geometry is see-saw. Given the asymmetric arrangement of atoms relative to the lone pair of electrons, the individual bond dipoles cannot cancel completely.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ has a trigonal pyramidal geometry, resulting in an asymmetrical arrangement of three bond dipoles that do not cancel. This creates a greater dipole moment than in SeO 2 F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E20@ , where the partially opposing dipoles of the two Se−O MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGtbGaaeyzaiabgkHiTiaab+eaaaa@3C78@ bonds and the two Se−F MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGtbGaaeyzaiabgkHiTiaabAeaaaa@3C6F@ bonds result in a smaller dipole moment. Thus, the dipole-dipole attractions between SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ molecules are stronger than those between SeO 2 F 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E20@ molecules, resulting in a higher melting point for SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ .
